sources.name: CMS Provider Information
sources.description: General information on currently active nursing homes, including certified beds, star ratings, staffing data, and Five-Star Rating System inputs.
knownLimitations: Does not include non-Medicare-certified SNFs

fields.description: CMS Certification Number (CCN)
Provider Name
Provider Street Address
Provider City/Town
Provider State – postal abbreviation
Provider Zip Code
Provider Phone Number
SSA county code
Provider County/Parish Name
Urban/Rural flag: Y=Urban; N=Rural. Urban is defined by a non-missing CBSA (core-based statistical area) code or a MSA (metropolitan statistical area) code > 0.

Unique name identifying a group of nursing homes that share at least one individual or organizational owner, officer, or entity with operational/managerial control
Unique numeric identifier assigned to each chain
Number of facilities in the chain. Missing if the provider is not part of a chain.
Average overall 5-star rating across all facilities in the chain. Missing if the provider is not part of a chain.
Average health inspection rating across all facilities in the chain. Missing if the provider is not part of a chain.
Average staffing rating across all facilities in the chain. Missing if the provider is not part of a chain.
Average quality measure (QM) rating across all facilities in the chain. Missing if the provider is not part of a chain.
Continuing Care Retirement Community Indicator
Special Focus Status (SFF, SFF Candidate or null if provider not SFF or Candidate)

Cited for abuse or neglect at harm level or above on survey cycle 1 (Scope/severity G or greater) or cited for abuse or neglect at potential harm level (Scope/Severity D or above) on both survey cycles 1 and 2.

sources.name: CMS Health Deficiencies
sources.description: Health citations from standard and complaint inspections in the last three survey cycles.
knownLimitations: Includes citations under IDR/IIDR dispute

fields.description: CMS Certification Number (CCN)
Provider Name
Provider Street Address
Provider City/Town
Provider State – postal abbreviation
Provider Zip Code
Date of Health Inspection Survey
Type of survey: Health or Fire Safety
The alphabetic character that is assigned to a series of data tags that apply to a provider (F)
Category of Health Deficiency
Deficiency Tag Number
Text definition of deficiency
Indicates the level of harm to the resident(s) involved and the scope of the problem within the nursing home
Indicates whether the deficiency has been corrected, a plan of correction has been devised, or the deficiency has yet to be corrected
Date the deficiency was corrected

The inspection cycle of deficiency for display on Nursing Home Compare, where 1 is the most recent cycle. Standard inspection cycles are counted sequentially into the past, complaint inspection cycles are counted annually into the past. If a deficiency is found on a co-occurring standard and complaint inspection, it is assigned to the standard cycle. Please refer to the 5-star Technical Users Guide for further information.
Indicates that the deficiency was found on a standard inspection
Indicates that the deficiency was found on a complaint inspection
Indicates that the deficiency was found on an infection control inspection
Indicates that the deficiency is under Informal Dispute Resolution (IDR)
Indicates that the deficiency is under Independent Informal Dispute Resolution (IIDR)
Location of facility (provider address, city, state, zip)
Date the data was retrieved

sources.name: CMS Fire Safety Deficiencies
sources.description: Fire safety and life safety code citations from inspections in the last three survey cycles.
knownLimitations: K-tags and E-tags have different version dates

fields.description: CMS Certification Number (CCN)
Provider Name
Provider Street Address
Provider City/Town
Provider State – postal abbreviation
Provider Zip Code
Survey Date
Type of survey: Health or Fire Safety
The alphabetic character that is assigned to a series of data tags that apply to a provider (K or E)
Category of Fire Safety Deficiency
Deficiency Tag Number

Indicates whether tag was cited before (old) or on/after (new) 7/5/2016; for a small number of life safety deficiencies (K tags), the same deficiency tag number has a different description in the two versions
Text definition of deficiency
Indicates the level of harm to the resident(s) involved and the scope of the problem within the nursing home (B-L)
Indicates whether the deficiency has been corrected, a plan of correction has been devised, or the deficiency has yet to be corrected
Date the deficiency was corrected

The inspection cycle of deficiency, where 1 is the most recent cycle. Standard inspection cycles are counted sequentially into the past, complaint inspection cycles are counted annually into the past. If a deficiency is found on a co-occurring standard and complaint inspection, it is assigned to the standard cycle. Life Safety Deficiencies are not used in calculating the Health Inspection Rating
Indicates that the deficiency was found on a standard inspection
Indicates that the deficiency was found on a complaint inspection
Indicates that the deficiency was found on an infection control inspection
Indicates that the deficiency is under Informal Dispute Resolution (IDR)
Indicates that the deficiency is under Independent Informal Dispute Resolution (IIDR)
Location of facility (provider address, city, state, zip)
Date the data was retrieved

sources.name: CMS Claims-Based Quality Measures

sources.name: CMS SNF Quality Reporting Program (Provider)

fields.description: The CMS certification number (CCN) is used to identify the facility listed.
Name of the facility.
The first line of the address of the facility.
The second line of the address of the facility. Note: This variable is only included in the Skilled Nursing Facility Quality Reporting Program – Swing Bed data.

The two-character postal code used to identify the state where the facility is located.
The five-digit postal ZIP code where the facility is located.
The name of the county/parish where the facility is located.

The CMS region where the facility is located. 1=Boston, 2=New York, 3=Philadelphia, 4=Atlanta, 5=Chicago, 6=Dallas, 7=Kansas City, 8=Denver, 9=San Francisco, 10=Seattle.
The measure code consists of the CMS ID (prefix) and the variable name (suffix) for the corresponding measure score. Example = S_038_02_ADJ_RATE. Prefix: S_038_02, Suffix: ADJ_RATE.

sources.name: CMS SNF Quality Reporting Program (National)
sources.description: National benchmark data for SNF QRP measures including national averages and performance distributions.

fields.description: The CMS certification number (CCN) is used to identify the facility listed. However, since this is the national data set, the CCN is listed as 'Nation.'

The measure code consists of the CMS ID (prefix) and the variable name (suffix) for the corresponding measure score. Example = S_038_02_NATL_OBS_RATE. Prefix: S_038_02, Suffix: NATL_OBS_RATE. See Table 20 for a complete listing of national data measure codes.
The measure score for the corresponding measure code.
Indicates the relevant footnote. Currently, there are no footnotes related to the national data.
The start date of the reporting period for the corresponding measure code and score.
The end date of the reporting period for the corresponding measure code and score.

The start date through the end date of the reporting period(s) for the corresponding measure code and score. Note: Only reporting periods that are 'split' are populated and represented by the use of a semicolon between the split periods (e.g., 04/01/2019-12/31/2019; 07/01/2020-09/30/2021).
National unadjusted average potentially preventable readmission rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed better than the national rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed no different than the national rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed worse than the national rate
Number of SNFs too small to report
National observed discharge to community rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed better than the national rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed no different than the national rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed worse than the national rate
Number of SNFs too small to report
MSPB score (national)
National rate - Percentage of residents whose medications were reviewed and who received follow-up care when medication issues were identified
National rate - Percentage of SNF residents who experience one or more falls with major injury during their SNF stay
National rate - Percentage of residents who are at or above an expected ability to care for themselves at discharge
National rate - Percentage of residents who are at or above an expected ability to move around at discharge
National rate - Percentage of residents with pressure ulcers/pressure injuries that are new or worsened
National observed healthcare-associated infection rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed better than the national rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed no different than the national rate
Number of SNFs in the nation that performed worse than the national rate
Number of SNFs too small to report
National rate of COVID-19 vaccination - Percentage of SNF healthcare personnel who are up to date with their COVID-19 vaccines
National rate of flu vaccination - Percentage of healthcare personnel who got a flu shot for the current season
National rate - Percentage of residents who are at or above an expected ability to care for themselves and move around at discharge
National rate - Percentage of residents where the SNF provided a current medication list to the next healthcare setting
National rate - Percentage of residents where the SNF provided a current medication list to the resident, family, and/or caregiver at final discharge
National rate - Percentage of SNF residents who are up to date with their COVID-19 vaccines

sources.name: CMS SNF Value-Based Purchasing (Facility)
sources.description: SNF VBP program facility-level performance scores, rankings, and incentive payment multipliers.
knownLimitations: Based on 30-day all-cause readmission measure only

fields.description: A skilled nursing facility's (SNF's) national rank among eligible, included SNFs in the SNF VBP Program. Calculated by sorting and ranking all eligible, included SNFs' performance scores. Lower ranks reflect better performance. Any SNFs with equal performance scores each receive the best (that is, lowest) rank within the tie.
Footnote for the SNF VBP Program Ranking
Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Certification Number (CCN)
Provider name
Provider address
Provider city/town
Provider state (2-digit postal code abbreviation)
Provider ZIP code

fields.fieldName: Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.description: A SNF's rate of unplanned readmissions during the baseline period (FY 2019), adjusted for stay-level risk factors such as clinical characteristics and comorbidities, as calculated by the SNF 30-Day All-Cause Readmission Measure (SNFRM).

fields.fieldName: Footnote -- Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Footnote -- Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.description: Footnote for the Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate

fields.fieldName: Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.description: A SNF's rate of unplanned readmissions during the performance period (FY 2023), adjusted for stay-level risk factors such as clinical characteristics and comorbidities, as calculated by the SNFRM.

fields.fieldName: Footnote -- Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Footnote -- Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
fields.description: Footnote for the Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate

A calculation of how well a SNF performed during the performance period (FY 2023) compared with national SNF performance during the baseline period (FY 2019). Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better performance.
Footnote for the Achievement Score
A calculation of how much a SNF has improved from the baseline period (FY 2019) to the performance period (FY 2023). Scores range from 0 to 90, with higher scores indicating better performance.
Footnote for the Improvement Score

The higher of a SNF's achievement score and improvement score. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better performance. CMS uses this score to calculate incentive payment multipliers for the SNF VBP Program.
Footnote for the Performance Score

A multiplier assigned to a SNF based on its performance in the SNF VBP Program. When payments are made to a SNF's Medicare fee-for-service (FFS) Part A claims in FY 2025, CMS multiplies the SNF's adjusted federal per diem rate by this multiplier.
Footnote for the Incentive Payment Multiplier

sources.name: CMS SNF Value-Based Purchasing (Aggregate)
sources.description: National aggregate performance data for the SNF VBP program including thresholds, benchmarks, and payment distributions.

fields.fieldName: Baseline Period: FY 2019 National Average Readmission Rate
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Baseline Period: FY 2019 National Average Readmission Rate
fields.description: The SNF VBP Program's unadjusted national average rate of unplanned readmissions in the baseline period (FY 2019).

fields.fieldName: Performance Period: FY 2023 National Average Readmission Rate
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Performance Period: FY 2023 National Average Readmission Rate
fields.description: The SNF VBP Program's unadjusted national average rate of unplanned readmissions in the performance period (FY 2023).

The 25th percentile of all SNFs' performance on the SNF 30-Day All-Cause Readmission Measure (SNFRM) during the baseline period (FY 2019). This value was previously published in the FY 2023 SNF Prospective Payment System (PPS) final rule (87 FR 47502).
The mean of the top decile of all SNFs' performance on the SNFRM during the baseline period (FY 2019). This value was previously published in the FY 2023 SNF PPS final rule (87 FR 47502).
The range of SNF VBP Program performance scores for the FY 2025 SNF VBP Program year.

fields.fieldName: Total Number of SNFs Receiving Value-Based Incentive Payments
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Total Number of SNFs Receiving Value-Based Incentive Payments
fields.description: The total number of SNFs receiving SNF VBP Program value-based incentive payments in FY 2025.
The range of SNF VBP Program incentive payment multipliers for the FY 2025 SNF VBP Program year.
The range of SNF VBP Program value-based incentive payments paid to SNFs in FY 2025.

fields.fieldName: Total Amount of Value-Based Incentive Payments ($)
fields.cmsColumnHeader: Total Amount of Value-Based Incentive Payments ($)
fields.description: The total amount of SNF VBP Program value-based incentive payments paid to SNFs in FY 2025.

sources.name: CMS Citation Code Reference
sources.description: Reference table of deficiency tag codes (F-tags, K-tags, E-tags) with descriptions and categories.

fields.description: Deficiency Prefix (F, K, E)
Deficiency Tag Number
Deficiency Prefix and Number (e.g., F-0880)
Deficiency Description
Category Description for Care Compare website

sources.name: CMS Footnote Reference
sources.description: Reference table of footnote codes used across CMS nursing home datasets.

fields.description: Newly certified nursing home with less than 12-15 months of data available or the nursing opened less than 6 months ago, and there were no data to submit or claims for this measure.
Not enough data available to calculate a star rating.
This facility submitted data that did not meet the criteria required to calculate a staffing measure.
CMS determined that the percentage was not accurate, or data suppressed by CMS for one or more quarters.
The number of residents or resident stays is too small to report. Call the facility to discuss this quality measure.
The data for this measure is missing or was not submitted. Call the facility to discuss this quality measure.
Results are based on a shorter time period than required.
This nursing home is not required to submit data for the Skilled Nursing Facility Quality Reporting Program.
This facility is not rated due to a history of serious quality issues and is included in the special focus facility program.
The accuracy of the data for this rating could not be validated by CMS.
The accuracy of the data for this measure could not be validated by CMS.
The street address for this facility could not be matched to latitude/longitude coordinates. Therefore, the latitude/longitude coordinates are based on the facility's zip code.
This facility did not submit staffing data.
This facility reported a high number of days without a registered nurse onsite.
The accuracy of the staffing data for this measure could not be validated by CMS.

This facility did not submit staffing data or submitted staffing data that is considered to be invalid for the purpose of calculating turnover. This measure will receive the minimum points for calculating the overall staffing score and rating.

This facility submitted staffing data that did not meet the criteria required to calculate a turnover measure. This measure will be excluded from the staffing rating and the staffing score will be rescaled.
This is an annual measure. Data for individual quarters is not available.

sources.name: State ALF Licensing Agencies
sources.description: Facility listings, capacity, and ownership information from state licensing agencies. Data format and availability varies by state.
knownLimitations: Data format varies significantly by state
Some states required FOIA requests for data access
Update schedules inconsistent across states

sources.name: US Census Bureau
sources.description: Demographics, population estimates, and projections for market analysis including 65+ and 85+ populations.
knownLimitations: Population projections are estimates with uncertainty
Data lags real-world by 1-2 years

sources.name: BLS Occupational Employment & Wage Statistics
sources.description: Wage data for healthcare workers including RNs, LPNs, CNAs, physical therapists, and administrative staff.
knownLimitations: Industry-specific wages (NAICS 623110) may have small sample sizes in some states

sources.name: AI-Extracted Deal Data
sources.description: Financial and operational data extracted from uploaded deal documents (CIMs, P&Ls, census reports, rate schedules) using Claude AI.
knownLimitations: Quality depends on source document quality
Confidence scores indicate extraction certainty
Some fields may require manual verification

sources.name: Cascadia Benchmarks
sources.description: Internal operational benchmarks and targets used for Pro Forma analysis and deal evaluation.
knownLimitations: Internal targets - not public benchmarks
